Description: Papyrus (twelve fragments); Hieratic funerary text with rubrics recto and verso. The very small fragments C and H are demotic. Fragment C has traces of a partial date and part of a personal name on the recto (three lines), which may belong to a documentary or accounts papyrus, and a few words of a literary narrative text on the verso (four lines). Fragment H has a couple of words of a literary narrative text on the recto (three lines); verso is blank.
Curator's comments: To be published by F. Herbin, Late Religious Texts. 3. The recto of the demotic fragment C has a date of regnal-year 36, which could be Ptolemy II, VIII or IX (or possibly Augustus). The literary narrative texts are of Roman date.
Being worked on by Andrea Kucharek (Heidelberg).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (380963) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/380963)
